record.description: Bronze figure (13 in.) 2100 B.C.E., from a brick foundation box at the main gateway to a temple in the city of Nippur in Iraq. Either Ur-Nammu, the founder of the third dynasty of Ur, or his son King Shulgi built the temple enclosure and the buildings within. While excavating the complex, a joint expedition of the University of Chicago and the American Schools of Oriental Research at Baghdad found the box, which also held ceramic beads, an inscribed tablet, and colored stones.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Separate caption and attached caption, photographer stamp.
